Node.definition: = man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= state in which humans and deities feel and show great joy
mainly in poetical texts: = state in which humans feel and show great joy
= action by which humans engage in non sanctioned worship, ◄ described in terms of prostitution
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= object given in possession to somebody else

= level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze
= seeds of cultivated cereal; ► used as food

= level, circular area about 7.5 to 12 meters in diameter, where people threshed their grain; usually located near the fields where the grain was grown, and if possible, in an elevated area that was exposed to the breeze

= a basin ◄ hewn out of a rock or lined with plaster ► into which harvested grapes were thrown and trampled to squeeze out the juice, which from there flowed into a trough or vat; ≈ treading a winepress is often used as a figure of speech to refer to God's anger and punishment

= causative action by which humans lead domestic animals to places where they can feed on grass and other edible materials in the field, ≈ often extended to denote the way a king cares for his subjects or the way God cares for his people

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of newly harvested grapes and possibly still at the beginning of the fermentation process; ► used as beverage and for sacrifice; ≈ represents the entire range of agricultural products in Israel, together with grain and oil; associated with joy and well being, and only once with drunkenness and foolishness
= state of not being available, ◄ described as not having been true
= state in which humans remain in a place that is not their home for a relatively short time

= the earth as opposed to the sky; sometimes used in a more specific sense to denote part of the earth, such as the dry land as opposed to the sea, or a specific region, area, country, or plot of land
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
literally: to turn; hence: = action by which animals, humans, or deities move back to a location where they have been before
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= nation; ◄ located in Northern Mesopotamia with Nineveh (נִינְוֵה) as its capital; regarded as descendants of Shem (שֵׁם)
= state in which humans, animals, or objects are regarded by the law as having been contaminated, ► as a result of which they cannot participate in social and religious activities
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object
= causative action by which humans pour out a liquid, ≈ exclusively used for libations
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= dark red alcoholic liquid; ◄ made out of grapes through the process of fermentation; ► used as beverage, though to be avoided by Nazirites, and by priests when on duty; ≈ associated with joy and well being, but also with drunkenness and foolishness; used as metaphor for anger, aggressive behavior, and sex

Node.gloss: to be pleasing|to be pleasant|to be sweet
Node.definition: = state in which an action brings about a positive and desireable feeling or reaction

= the human activity of killing one or more animals as a religious sacrifice; usually part of the animal is offered to the deity and part is eaten by the worshipers; often accompanied by the burning of incense
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general
= state of deep sorrow and grief; ◄ caused by the death of a relative or friend or by other tragic circumstances
= action by which someone consumes food; with or without explicit object

= action by which humans cause themselves to become contaminated, ◄ as a result unlawful activities or contact with what has been contaminated, ► which often results in their inability to participate in social and religious activities, until this state is reversed through prescribed rituals and procedures
= a staple food ◄ made from a dough of water and either wheat or barley then baked; ► together with water considered the very basis of life, often used to refer to food in general

literally: throat, as the part of the body that contains the passage ways for blood, air, and food; hence: = the life principle that animates both humans and animals, turns them into breathing living beings, and functions as the center of their personality, mind, physical and non physical desires, courage, emotions, and affections; it is believed to reside in the blood

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

Node.gloss: to do|to perform|to commit|to practice|to observe|to celebrate|to keep
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities engage in a particular action

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= a festival that is celebrated at fixed times

= a basic unit of time, including evening (עֶרֶב) and morning (בֹּקֶר) seven days make a week (שְׁבוּעָה) sometimes used in a figurative sense referring to a limited period of time, which may be shorter or slightly longer than a single day; the context often makes it difficult to determine
= celebration, usually of a religious nature; ≈ associated with joy
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses
= action by which humans, deities, or animals move forward, usually towards a specific destination
= action by which humans or wild animals attack other humans and kill, destroy and steal in the process
= nation and their territory; ◄ regarded as founded by one of the sons of Ham (חָם) with the same name
= causative action by which humans or deities cause humans or animals to come together as a group for a common purpose
= town, also known as Memphis; ◄ in Egypt (מִצְרַיִם) ► residence and capital of many of its kings (ABD)

= to put the body of someone who died in a designated place, such as a hole in a rock or in the ground, or in a place which was constructed specifically for this purpose; ≈ associated with death, but also with honor and respect
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value
= silver, usually in the form of small unstamped pieces that had to be weighed in order to determine their value; after the exile, people in Israel started using coins
= thorny plant ► considered to be a weed; ≈ associated with neglect and desolation
= action by which humans take ownership of land and other possessions
= plant with thorns; ► useless; ≈ regarded as ugly and useless
= location where a family or household lives, or where a deity is said to reside
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time
literally: to know; hence: = process by which humans know what a certain experience is about by studying or living through it

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= pertaining to being foolish, which manifests itself in a lack of fear of God, unwillingness to listen to advice, much talking, and being unable to conceal one's emotions
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= state in which humans are (considered) out of their mind; ≈ often used as an insult, especially of prophets

= an invisible being that is in a direct relation to and under control of God and one of his manifestation, often described as a substance that can be poured out, ► through whom the universe is created and animated; it can manifest itself as an invisible force equipping humans with wisdom, skill, and strength for specific tasks; it can also manifest itself as a movement of air through the bodies of animate creatures (breath) or through nature (wind)
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= process by which an event increases in intensity

= person ► appointed to watch the surroundings of a town or settlement and raise the alarm in case of danger; ≈ regarded as a grave responsibility, for which reason the task of a king or prophet is sometimes compared to that of a watchman
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= male person speaking on behalf of a deity
= contraption; ► used for catching animals; ≈ associated with aggression and control
= someone who has made it his profession to catch animals and birds with the help of nets and traps; ≈ associated with aggression and oppression
literally: road; hence: = pattern of behavior, with a primary focus on moral and ethical behavior, ◄ understood as a journey through life

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
literally: days; hence: = an unspecified amount of time

= town, possibly to be identified with Geba (גֶּבַע) ◄ territory of Benjamin (בִּנְיָמִן) ► place where someone's concubine (פִּילֶגֶשׁ) was raped by a large group of men; home town of King Saul (שָׁאוּל)

Node.gloss: to remember|to call to mind|to be mindful|to bear in mind|to consider
Node.definition: = action by which humans or deities reprocess information that is stored in their mind
= a deed of deliberate wrongdoing resulting in a state of guilt which requires punishment
= action by which deities or humans inflict a penalty on other deities, humans, animals, or objects, usually as retribution for an offence
= action by which a human being commits a wrongful act against God or someone else, whether on purpose or not, ► which may require atonement, restitution, and/or retribution
= area not very suitable for sedentary life and agriculture because of its lack of water; suitable for grazing domestic animals and only inhabited by nomadic tribes and wild animals
= process by which humans or objects come upon (other) humans or objects without searching

= man, also known as Jacob (יַעֲקֹב) and Jeshurun (יְשֻׁרוּן) including the ethnic group that is regarded to be his descendants; ◄ son of Isaac (יִצְחָק) and Rebekah (רִבְקָה) brother of Esau (עֵשָׂו) and ► father of twelve sons after whom the tribes of Israel were named and one daughter
= fruit of the fig (תְּאֵנָה) tree, of the variety that ripens early (in June); ► appreciated because of their fine flavor

= a tree that reaches a height of 5 8 m, with a round crown and very deep roots; its fruit is about the size of a hen’s egg and can be green, yellow, purple, or brown depending on the type; ◄ Ficus carica; ► the fruits are sweet and soft; ≈ the image of peace and happiness in Israel was: “every man under his vine and under his fig tree
= state in which a countable entity is the first or the previous in a range

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= indirect male progenitor
= location of temple of Baal Peor
= substitute for Baal (בַּעַל) ◄ as the one who causes shame for whom one should be ashamed

= a reference to the physical likeness or representation of a person, animal, or thing, ► functioning as an object of non sanctioned worship, ≈ with a very strong added connotation of something utterly detestable
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice|= act of having sexual relations
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
literally: to fly away; hence: = process by which an event stops happening ◄ like a bird that flies away and vanishes from sight
= position of honor; ◄ often as a result of wealth and/or authority
= process by which a female gives birth to offspring; ≈ associated with pain and anguish
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= process by which someone becomes pregnant
= marker indicating that the event in focus has to be true before another event can take place

Node.gloss: to make grow|to bring up|to rear|to educate|to tend
Node.definition: = causative process by which humans take care of young plants or young humans while they undergo the natural development of increasing in size and changing physically on their way to being fully grown

marker identifying the entity that is directly targeted by the event in focus, and which usually is already part of the cognitive context; described in syntactic terms as the direct object marker; untranslatable in English unless accompanied by a suffix
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= human being as an individual or as a class of living creatures; sometimes explicitly subdivided between male (זָכָר) and female (נְקֵבָה) ≈ associated with mortality
marker expressing a speaker's confirmation of the truth of a statement; in some cases the truth of this statement is conceded
exclamation expressing grief and dismay
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= a linker introducing a propostion that contains the content of what precedes

= process or action by which living creatures perceive something, primarily though not necessarily exclusively with their eyes, either as a spontaneous incident or as the result of focusing the eyes on something
= town; ◄ on the Phoenician coast; ► famous as sea port

= causative action by which a tree is planted after having been uprooted from another place, either as a young sapling or as a mature tree, ≈ often used as a metaphor for a nation being made to dwell in a certain place
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe

Node.gloss: to bring out|to take out|to carry out|to make (someone) leave|to make (someone) depart
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans or deities cause (other) humans, animals, or objects to leave a certain place or position
= causative action by which someone takes the life of a person, animal, or plant in a violent way
= direct or indirect human offspring, either male or indeterminate, either biologically or through adoption
= deity; ► God of Israel who revealed himself to Moses

= a reference to an unknown object or event; normally used with the purpose of identifying that object; sometimes used in rhetorical questions expressing one's conviction that that object or event cannot be identified

= part of the lower body of women and mammals where offspring are conceived and in which they grow until their birth; ≈ sometimes extended to refer to a woman, the time of birth, the place where something is produced, and the innermost part of an area
= one of the breasts of a woman or other female mammal
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong, resulting in a state of guilt and, eventually, hardship and suffering

= location; ◄ close to Jericho (יְרִחֹו) ► first camp of Israelites (יִשְׂרָאֵל) after crossing the Jordan (יַרְדֵּן) here they set up twelve stones as a monument; it later became the location of a cultic center
= state in which humans or deities experience hostility towards a person, an object, or a practice
= state in which an event is morally and/or ethically wrong
= a pattern of activities performed by a person or deity, with the primary focus on whether these activities are good or evil

= construction surrounded by walls and covered with a roof; ◄ normally made of stones, wood, or clay; ► to be used as living quarters, for storage, as a prison, as a sanctuary, etc.; sometimes used to denote a smaller part of a large construction
= causative action by which people are expelled from their dwelling place
= process by which an action is repeated or continued
= state in which humans or deities experience a feeling of affection for a person, an object, or a practice
= someone in a position of authority in an army, at a royal court, of a town, within a family, among priests, or elsewhere
= state by which humans or animals stand up to or oppose the authority of a person or ruler or deity
= reference to the northern kingdom of Israel (יִשְׂרָאֵל) of which Ephraim was the most important tribe
= a part of a plant normally below ground, which acts as a support and collects water and nourishment, ≈ associated with well being, offspring, and the inclination of the mind
= process by which objects containing liquid essential to their existence lose these liquids ◄ due to some external or internal cause
= produce from crop bearing trees and plants
= particle marking a proposition as not true

Node.gloss: to bear|to yield|to produce|to bring forth
Node.definition: literally: to make; hence: = natural process by which land, plants, or animals develop vegetation, branches, fruits, produce milk, etc.

Node.gloss: also|too|even|moreover|what is more|what is worse|furthermore|besides|both … and
Node.definition: marker pointing to information that needs to be considered in addition to previous information (either explicit or implied)
= process by which females among humans or animals give birth to offspring through the process of conception, pregnancy, and labor; ≈ sometimes associated with painful toil and anxiety

Node.gloss: to cause to die|to kill|to put to death
Node.definition: = causative action by which humans, animals, or deities cause (other) humans or animals to stop living
= inanimate objects that are the object of someone's desire, ◄ because of their quality or value
= front part of the human trunk below the ribs, containing the stomach, bowels, and reproductive organs; ≈ associated with birth, food, speech, and the innermost part of objects
= state in which humans or deities are unwilling to engage in any way with (other) humans or deities, or with other objects and events
plural with singular meaning: = generic term for a supernatural being, worshiped by individuals or entire nations
= action by which humans and animals leave their home or move about from place to place without clear destination

= a large body of people united by common descent, religion, or language, inhabiting a particular state or territory, led by one common leader; often referring to the non Israelite nations, especially when used in plural
